channel.title: The Financial Crises
channel.description:
Who is to blame for the world economic collapse?
Choose one of these options, or don't, frankly I don't give a damn.
[b]John Law[/b] [img]http://www.mapforum.com/05/law2.jpg[/img]
John Law was a Scottish conman who invented modern finance as a way to finance his gambling debts. He was a known murderer and evil genius; he used to win at poker by calculating odds while he played. Adam Smith was a kind of sappy retard compared to John Law. John Law died poor and the country he was advising (France) went down the shitter, but his noble ideology of taking as much as you can and then running the fuck away, lives on.
[b]Barack Obama[/b] [img]http://weblogs.newsday.com/sports/watchdog/blog/BarackObama_playoff.jpg[/img]
Barack Obama, he talks the talk, walks the walk; but nobody has any fucking idea what he's talking about or where he's going. One thing is for sure, Obama wants you to go with him, off to a magical place called hope. You can only get there by traveling on his fantastic flying ship called change. What is going to change? Only Barack really knows. Long ago Obama destroyed his reputation with people who care about shit by endorsing the War On Terrorism, which even Faux News tacitly reports is also a convenient [url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,296938,00.html]war for oil[/url]. Oh, I forgot to mention, he's the US president.
[b]God[/b]
[img]http://i197.photobucket.com/albums/aa202/shhealing/sistineGod.jpg[/img]
God is a deity who might have created the universe and mankind, and therefore the current financial crises as well. Some people claim that you can't blame god, you can only worship him and ask for his forgiveness, while others don't even believe in god, choosing instead to believe in the invisible pink unicorn or the great teacup in the sky.
[b]Karl Marx[/b]
[img]http://www.historyguide.org/images/marx-bio.jpg[/img]
German philosopher who probably felt more than a little bit guilty when people started to take him too seriously. Compared to Kant or Nietzsche he was a whiny little kid with too many toys. People who don't understand history like to give him a god-like status and superpowers. Just like god, people love to blame shit on him.
[b]Other[/b]
As you like it.

item.title: The Financial Crises
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

The loans are pretty much exactly the reason…Some redneck buys some expensive house (with loan from the bank), no way in hell he’s gonna pay for it. Value of house goes down, he gives it back to the bank… Now the bank is left with something less than what they gave.

Especially in american, I don’t understand why people are so free so abuse credit cards and loans/etc.

The credit card companies aren’t doing well in a recession either, and they put themselves on it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Financial Crises
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Niall:

and banks generally taking risks with money they don’t own…

That’s what they always do, and normally it won’t cause problems. Heck, it’s good that they do it because that stimulates the economy. But this crisis is a crisis because they took too big risks. As bowserjr2 said: they gave loans to people who shouldn’t receive loans.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:11, topic:262257”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=346354.msg2668403#msg2668403 date=1234708660]
theres a financial crisis these days !?
[/quote]In US, France, Germany, etc…

I personally believe our economic system is faulty… Like, it works well but every few decades it fails. And it’ll continue doing that.[/quote]

It works very well for those who can hop on the train. But those who cant won’t get anywhere. And it’s greed that made it fall, not the system itself.

Read full topic

item.title: The Financial Crises
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

free market capitalism

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:262257”]Other

Its our new way of living. America thinks that as long as you “get” the money physically it doesnt matter. Our Greed and self-centred life-styles that involves £10k doormats and peices of chewing gum.
The English Goverment is just as stupid! They lower Interest Rates to a biblical 1% and expect us to start borrowing again. Borrowing too much was what got us inside this hole the first place. Now people with money in the Bank are suffering! If only everyone had the guts of Jeremy Clarkson![/quote]

you’re a moron

Read full topic

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:262257”]Other
The English Goverment is just as stupid! They lower Interest Rates to a biblical 1% and expect us to start borrowing again. Borrowing too much was what got us inside this hole the first place. Now people with money in the Bank are suffering![/quote]
